description: Inside this room cut from the volcano rock stands a giant iron
cylinder sitting on its side.  At one end a large shaft slowly pulls
out and pushes back in, driving by an iron arm connected to a large
geared wheel.  Above the geared wheel is another gear, smaller,
connected to a large shaft running into the eastern wall.  A small
flow of water trickles out from underneath the shaft.  A large pipe
runs in from the southern wall and connects underneath the iron
cylinder.  A second pipe running from the top disappears into the
northern wall.  Only a small light comes from an orb hanging from the
ceiling.

carved into the stone wall hold the makou oil, the fuel used in
airships.  Hoses run off each tank, and hang on the wall.  A metal
walkway extends from this ledge out into the shaft of the airship
facility.  A desk sits on one corner, and a few chairs line the wall
to sit at.  Welcome to the Makou City Fueling Station.
